definition: Salvation Army (protestant philanthropic organization founded in London in 1865)

sentences.english: Nuwa not only to the day of salvation, but also in creation, work miracles.
sentences.chinese: 女娲不但补天救世，还创造万物，神通广大。

sentences.english: But they want to make your world perfect and be your savior.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们想让你的世界变得完美，成为你的救世主。

sentences.english: Similar to the Redeemer, the Hexapod can both deal and absorb a significant amount of damage.
sentences.chinese: 类似的救世主，六脚即可以输出和吸收大量的伤害。

sentences.english: The savior is also recurrently crucified.
sentences.chinese: 救世主也总是一再受难。

sentences.english: Mathematics became the savior of the Givin people, and became central to their culture.
sentences.chinese: 数学成了吉文人的救世主，成为其文化的核心科学。

sentences.english: There was an evil sorcerer and a great battle, and my parents were saviors.
sentences.chinese: 那里有一个邪恶的巫师和一场大战，我父母是救世主。
是什么让乔帮主成了数码救世主？

sentences.english: Hhe pen is the great liberator of men and nations.
sentences.chinese: 他的笔就是人类和各个民族的救世主。

sentences.english: Donate extra clothes and furniture to friends, or even better, the Salvation Army.
sentences.chinese: 多余的衣服和家具，捐给朋友，或者捐给救世军更好。

sentences.english: They seemed barbarians, and they were saviours .
sentences.chinese: 他们貌似蛮族，却都是救世主。

sentences.english: One of them is the descending and ascending redeemer figure.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一就是上去下来的救世主形象。

sentences.english: Guyun salvation must save the heart.
It is likely, however, that the Magi were familiar with the great Messianic prophesies .
sentences.chinese: 这是有可能，但是，贤士熟悉伟大救世主的预言。

sentences.english: Survivors of it feel compelled to search out a savior.
sentences.chinese: 幸存者们感到有必要把他们的救世主找出来。

sentences.english: Before the earthquake, we had never thought of ourselves as Rose’s saviors.
sentences.chinese: 在地震发生之前，我们从未想过要做罗丝的救世主。

sentences.english: We had never thought of ourselves as Rose’s saviors.
sentences.chinese: 我们从未想过要做罗丝的救世主。

definition: (Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
to help the dying and heal the injured
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to bemoan the state of the universe and pity the fate of mankind
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
